}}'''''Arda Philology 7''''' is the seventh volume of the journal ''[[Arda (annual)|Arda Philology]]'', and contains the proceedings of the Seventh International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages, ''[https://www.omentielva.com/oquainea.htm Omentielva Quainea] ([[Omentielva]])'', which was held at California State University East Bay in Hayward, in August [[2017]].<center>[[Arda Philology 6|Previous Issue]] || '''Next Issue'''</center>

==Contents==

*Foreword
*Contents
*Contributors' Biographies
*Index Locorum
*Alexander Zapryagaev: "Poetic Metre and Prosody in [[Eldarin]] Languages"
*[[Bill Welden]]: "How We Got [[Sindarin|Sindarin]]"
*[[Roman Rausch]]: "Mapping out Semantic Spaces in [[Elvish]]"
*Miriam Mayburd: "Dream-words, Dream-lore, and Languages of Ascent: Tolkien's [[Qenya]] and [[Gnomish]] Lexicons in Light of Medieval Contemplative Practices and Synaesthetics"
*Måns Berg: " 'Usually Omitted': The Long and Convoluted History of [[Hwesta Sindarinwa|hwesta sindarinwa]]"
*Henrik Williams (with contributions by the editor): "The Saluda Runestone and the Russellville Inscription"

==External links==

*[https://www.omentielva.com/ardaph7.htm Arda Philology Volume 7]
